answers.answer: It depends on how bad your diabetic retinopathy is or if there is any evidence of proliferative diabetic retinopathy.  Call back and have the nurse double check with the specialist himself to see if such a delay in the Lucentis will be safe for your specific situation.  If it is only for macular edema, your vision may worsen from swelling but little long term damage could occur by delaying the injection by a month for the swelling.HV

question: My retina specialist has been giving me lucentis injections every two months for diabetic macular edema.  My vision has already been affected by this condition but the injedctions return it to almost normal.  I had an appointment for January 16th but the doctor cancelled and rescheduled for February 20th.  I'm worried I'll lose morevision or even go blind before then(I've heard diabetes can cause blindness very quickly).   Am I overreacting?
title: Will I go blind before I can get my lucentis injection?
